overview_of_class: This course is designed to help students improve their listening comprehension and speaking skills to become creative, independent, and sophisticated users of spoken German. A variety of exercises will guide students through increasingly complex speaking tasks such as descriptions, historical narratives, reports, discussions, and short debates. We will use a variety of materials such as literary material and authentic material from the German press, German television, news broadcasts, documentaries and film excerpts for interpretive activities and discussions. The class will be tailored to students` interests and needs.
name: Speaking as Discovery

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
? To feel more confident to participate actively in small group and class discussions on a variety of topics that include personal as well as public themes.
? To have better expressive skills to be able to communicate ideas clearly, fluently, and meaningfully, especially on topics discussed and practiced in class, but also on topics not practiced before.
? To increase language skills in fluency, breadth of vocabulary, accuracy of expression, and complexity.
? To develop an awareness and knowledge of current cultural and political events in Germany and Europe.
